stance_1: I eat meat almost every day
justification: The interviewee states that due to finances, their diet is mostly meat, making the connection explicit and strong.

stance_1: I eat meat almost every day
justification: Saving vegan recipes and planning to make vegan food conflicts with the current behavior of eating meat almost every day.

stance_1: I eat meat almost every day
stance_2: I try to eat fruits and vegetables some days
justification: The desire and occasional attempt to eat fruits and vegetables some days is in conflict with the stated behavior of eating meat almost every day.
The interviewee states explicitly that financial limitations prevent them from eating less meat, which conflicts with their motivation and planning to eat vegan.

stance_2: I try to eat fruits and vegetables some days
justification: The interviewee mentions that financial limitations are a barrier to eating more fruits and vegetables instead of meat.

stance_2: I want to have more energy
justification: Financial limitations may hinder the ability to pursue a diet (such as more plant-based) that the interviewee believes might increase their energy.

stance_2: I want to maintain a healthy weight
justification: The interviewee’s financial limitations may prevent following the dietary practices (such as reducing meat) that they believe help maintain a healthy weight.

stance_2: I try to eat fruits and vegetables some days
justification: Saving vegan recipes supports the intention and occasional behavior of eating more fruits and vegetables.

stance_2: I want to have more energy
justification: Saving vegan recipes and planning to make vegan food may be motivated by the desire for more energy, which is mentioned as a key motivation.

stance_2: I want to maintain a healthy weight
justification: Saving vegan recipes and planning to make vegan food may be motivated by the desire to maintain a healthy weight, which is a stated motivation.

stance_1: I try to eat fruits and vegetables some days
stance_2: I want to have more energy
justification: Eating more fruits and vegetables may be intended to support having more energy, as the interviewee cites energy as an important motivation.

stance_1: I try to eat fruits and vegetables some days

justification: Trying to eat more fruits and vegetables is plausibly motivated by the desire to maintain a healthy weight, a stated motivation.
